item.title: 大自然的金融创新带来希望，也引发了对 "洗绿 "的担忧
item.description: 今天的时事通讯将介绍查尔斯国王和其他英国土地所有者如何进入一个新市场来拯救自然。应对生物多样性危机以及金融可以发挥的作用将是下周 COP16 峰会的焦点。阅读本篇报道的完整版本，请访问 Bloomberg.com。有关气候变化和环境的更多报道，请订阅。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at how King Charles and other British landowners are jumping into a new market to save nature. Tackling the biodiversity crisis, and the role finance can play, will be the focus of next week’s COP16 summit. Read the full version of this story at Bloomberg.com. For more coverage of climate change and the environment, please subscribe.】

item.title: 美国大选让气候科技投资者进入观望模式
item.description:
由于融资方和创始人都在面对特朗普第二次当选总统的前景及其对减碳技术的影响，因此资本市场停滞不前。【原文：

Capital has stalled as financers and founders confront the prospect of a second Trump presidency and its impact on carbon-cutting technologies.

】

item.title: 拉尼娜现象可能引发极地涡旋事件，欧洲为寒流做好准备
item.description: 随着弱拉尼娜天气模式的最终到来，欧洲预计将迎来一个凉爽无风的 11 月，这将为今年冬天带来更高的极地涡旋事件风险。【原文：Europe is forecast to have a cool and windless November as a weak La Niña weather pattern finally arrives, bringing a higher risk of polar vortex events this winter.】

item.title: Uber 首席执行官谈电动汽车、Robotaxis 和气候目标
item.description:
"我们认为 Uber 的未来是电动的、共享的、自主的，最终也是多式联运的，"Uber 首席执行官达拉-科斯罗萨西（Dara Khosrowshahi）在本周的Zero节目中说道。【原文：

“We think that the future for Uber is electric, shared, autonomous and ultimately multimodal as well,” Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi says on this week’s episode of Zero.

】

item.title: 查尔斯国王和大银行投身拯救自然的新市场
item.description:
在金融家和外交官齐聚联合国生物多样性峰会之际，英国土地所有者正在探索新兴保护市场的前景和风险。【原文：

As financiers and diplomats gather for the UN’s biodiversity summit, British landowners are exploring the promise — and risk — of nascent markets for conservation.

】

item.title: 悉尼著名的邦迪海滩因有毒沥青球冲上岸而关闭
item.description: 最近几天，数以千计的有毒焦油球被冲上海岸，悉尼著名的邦迪海滩（Bondi Beach）已经关闭，该市风景如画的东海岸其他几个热门游泳地点也已关闭。【原文：Sydney’s famous Bondi Beach has been closed, joining several other popular swimming spots along the city’s picturesque east coast, after thousands of toxic tar balls washed ashore in recent days.】

item.title: 英国努力消除银行家在过渡融资问题上的 "瘫痪状态
item.description: 如果银行和投资者要为高碳企业转型为未来的绿色企业提供资金，那么决策者和公众就需要更大程度地接受这一点，即这将使金融家的投资组合看起来更脏。【原文：If banks and investors are going to finance the transformation of high-carbon companies into the green corporations of tomorrow, there needs to be a greater acceptance by policymakers and the public that this will make financiers’ portfolios look dirtier.】

item.title: 摩根大通为萨尔瓦多完成 10 亿美元债务转换交易
item.description: 摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. has structured a $1 billion deal for El Salvador, equivalent to roughly 14% of its debt, in an arrangement that allows the country to refinance a portion of its debt and help fund the conservation of its wetlands.】

item.title: 夏威夷公用事业公司因野火威胁切断毛伊岛电力
item.description: 夏威夷电力公司（Hawaiian Electric）表示，由于大风和干燥的环境为野火风险创造了成熟的条件，该公司将切断茂宜岛西侧社区的电力供应。【原文：Hawaiian Electric said it will cut power to communities on the western side of Maui as high winds and dry conditions create conditions ripe for the risk of wildfires.】

item.title: 菲利普斯 66 在商业机密案中被要求支付 6.049 亿美元
item.description: 陪审团表示，菲利普斯 66 公司在准备进军加州可再生能源市场时，曾考虑收购一家低碳燃料供应商，但该公司窃取了该供应商的商业机密，菲利普斯 66 公司应为此支付 6.049 亿美元。【原文：Phillips 66 should pay $604.9 million for stealing trade secrets from a low-carbon fuel provider that it considered acquiring while preparing to enter the California renewables market, a jury said.】

item.title: 报告警告：水危机危及高收入国家 8%的 GDP
item.description:
水资源匮乏、降雨模式变化和地下水过度使用都对世界经济构成日益严峻的威胁。【原文：

Scarcity, changing rainfall patterns and groundwater overuse all pose an increasingly dire threat to the world economy.

】

item.title: 美国为吉沃清洁燃料项目提供 14.6 亿美元融资
item.description: 拜登政府正在向生物燃料公司 Gevo Inc. 提供 14.6 亿美元的融资，用于在南达科他州普雷斯顿湖建立将玉米淀粉转化为喷气燃料的大型设施。【原文：The Biden administration is offering biofuel company Gevo Inc. $1.46 billion in financing for a large-scale facility that turns corn starch into jet fuel in Lake Preston, South Dakota.】

item.title: 最高法院暂时批准美国环保署的电厂排放限制令
item.description: 美国最高法院允许环境保护局继续执行其严格的发电厂新排放限制规定，回绝了企业和共和党掌管的各州对该规定将带来高昂合规成本的抱怨。【原文：The US Supreme Court let the Environmental Protection Agency move ahead with its stringent new emissions limits for power plants, rebuffing businesses and Republican-run states that complained the rules will impose exorbitant compliance costs.】

item.title: 瑞士信贷创建的债务互换在华尔街受到青睐
item.description: 在全球债务市场的一个小角落里，一个由瑞士信贷银行家小组三年前首次构建的产品正在悄然兴起。【原文：In a niche corner of global debt markets, a product first structured three years ago by a group of Credit Suisse bankers is having a moment.】

item.title: 波兰图斯克将清洁能源视为经济增长的新引擎
item.description: 波兰总理唐纳德-图斯克（Donald Tusk）表示，向清洁能源的过渡可为波兰未来的经济增长提供动力，这表明波兰政府希望认真对待摆脱煤炭的问题。【原文：Prime Minister Donald Tusk said the transition to clean energy sources could fuel Poland’s future economic growth in a sign that his government wants to get serious about weaning the country off coal.】

item.title: 谷歌称核能是实现全天候清洁能源的关键
item.description: Alphabet 公司的谷歌能源与气候高级总监迈克尔-特雷尔（Michael Terrell）在彭博社电视台上表示，谷歌将核能视为其战略的关键部分，以获得全天候的清洁能源来运行人工智能设施。【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s Google sees nuclear power as a key part of its strategy to get around-the-clock clean energy to operate artificial intelligence facilities, Michael Terrell, senior director of energy and climate, said on Bloomberg Television.】

item.title: 干旱耗尽水电，赞比亚批准新建煤电厂
item.description: 赞比亚批准建设第三座燃煤发电厂，以应对因创纪录的干旱造成的电力危机。【原文：Zambia approved the construction of a third coal-fired power plant as it battles a power crisis caused by a record drought, which has stricken its hydro-electricity generation.】

item.title: 长期不受青睐的核能正在卷土重来
item.description: 核电长期以来一直在走下坡路，其在世界发电量中所占的比例从 20 世纪 90 年代中期的 18% 降至现在的 9%，减少了一半。现在有了复苏的迹象。【原文：Nuclear power has long been on the decline, its share of the world’s electricity generation halving from 18% in the mid-1990s to 9% today. Now there are signs of a revival.】

item.title: 大英图书馆利用太阳能热能保存莎士比亚第一对开本作品
item.description:
在英国国家图书馆屋顶安装太阳能热管的项目将减少碳排放，并保护珍贵手稿的安全

。【原文：

Project installing solar thermal tubes on the roof of the UK’s national library will cut carbon emissions and keep valuable manuscripts safe

】

item.title: S&P 公司称新兴市场将获得价值 5 万亿美元的绿色能源
item.description: 根据 S&P Global Commodity Insights 的报告，随着全球转向清洁能源发电以减少排放，预计到 2040 年，新兴市场将开发价值 5.1 万亿美元的绿色发电项目。【原文：Green power projects worth $5.1 trillion are expected to be developed in emerging markets by 2040 as the world shifts to cleaner energy generation to cut emissions, according to S&P Global Commodity Insights.】

item.title: 肯-格里芬，亚马逊投资新一代核能
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）和亿万富翁金融家肯-格里芬（Ken Griffin）是投资小型核反应堆的支持者之一，该技术正在蓬勃发展，被誉为原子能的下一个时代。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. and billionaire financier Ken Griffin are among the backers anchoring a $500 million investment in small nuclear reactors, a burgeoning technology that has been heralded as the next era for atomic energy.】

item.title: 美国向电动汽车电池零部件制造商提供 6.71 亿美元，用于在佐治亚州建厂
item.description: 拜登政府准备向 Aspen Aerogels 公司提供近 6.71 亿美元的贷款，用于在大选必争之地佐治亚州生产电动汽车电池的关键部件。【原文：The Biden administration is poised to loan nearly $671 million to Aspen Aerogels Inc. to make a key component of electric car batteries in the election battleground state of Georgia.】

item.title: 英国蒸发的洪水保险
item.description: 对许多英国人来说，本周是一次恶劣天气事件一周年纪念日。去年 10 月，"巴贝特 "风暴给英格兰和威尔士带来了自 1891 年以来第三次最潮湿的三天，成千上万的家庭被洪水淹没。【原文：This week marks the one-year anniversary of a grim weather event for many Britons. Last October Storm Babet brought the third wettest three-day period in a series for England and Wales since 1891, flooding thousands of homes.】

item.title: 在下一场暴风雨来临之前，巴黎和伦敦沐浴在秋日的温暖之中
item.description: 巴黎和伦敦的气温高于平均水平，欧洲大部分地区都被温暖的气候所笼罩。【原文：Paris and London are experiencing above-average temperatures, as warmer conditions envelop much of Europe.】

item.title: 摩洛哥为世界杯将西撒哈拉绿色电力输出增加一倍
item.description: 摩洛哥因其对西撒哈拉的统治最近得到外国承认而受到鼓舞，计划在共同主办 2030 年国际足联世界杯之前，将争议领土上的绿色电力生产增加一倍，以满足日益增长的需求。【原文：Morocco, buoyed by recent foreign recognition of its rule over Western Sahara, plans to double green electricity production in the disputed territory to meet growing demand before it co-hosts the 2030 FIFA World Cup.】

item.title: 英国在与毁灭性洪灾的抗争中败下阵来
item.description: 首创的保险计划为加固洪水防御设施赢得了时间，但独家数据显示，加固洪水防御设施的速度还不够快。【原文：A first-of-its-kind insurance program bought time to shore up flood defenses, but exclusive data shows that isn’t happening quickly enough.】

item.title: 银行不断向客户注入数十亿资金 威胁热带雨林
item.description: 一项新的研究显示，银行和资产管理公司继续向那些其业务直接威胁到包括亚马逊在内的热带雨林未来的公司输送数百亿美元。【原文：Banks and asset managers are continuing to channel tens of billions of dollars into companies whose operations directly threaten the future of tropical rainforests, including the Amazon, according to a new study.】

item.title: 以绿色债务为生的亿万富豪家族面临毁林指控
item.description:
塔诺托家族的皇家金鹰公司帮助生产从P&G的Head & Shoulders洗发水到联合利华的Fudgsicles等家用产品，该公司否认了这些指控，同时吹嘘其在可持续发展方面所做的努力。【原文：

The Tanotos’ Royal Golden Eagle, which helps make household products from P&G’s Head & Shoulders shampoo to Unilever’s Fudgsicles, denies the allegations while touting its sustainability efforts.

】

item.title: PG&E 警告称火灾风险可能导致大范围停电
item.description: PG&E 公司表示，从本周晚些时候开始，预计干燥的大风将席卷加州，届时可能需要对加州大部分地区的家庭和企业断电。【原文：PG&E Corp. said it may need to cut power to homes and businesses across a large portion of California starting later this week when dry, gusty winds are expected to sweep across the state.】

item.title: 飓风米尔顿估计将使保险公司损失近 360 亿美元
item.description: 据风险建模公司 Karen Clark & Co 估计，飓风米尔顿造成的损失预计将使保险公司损失近 360 亿美元。【原文：Damage from Hurricane Milton is expected to cost insurers almost $36 billion, according to an estimate from risk modeling firm Karen Clark & Co.】
